metadata.title: CVE-2013-3722 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
A Denial of Service (infinite loop) exists in OpenSIPS before 1.10 inlookup.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-3722` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

opensips - 1.10
opensips-b2bua-module - 1.10
opensips-berkeley-bin - 1.10
opensips-berkeley-module - 1.10
opensips-carrierroute-module - 1.10
opensips-compression-module - 1.10
opensips-console - 1.10
opensips-cpl-module - 1.10
opensips-dbhttp-module - 1.10
opensips-dialplan-module - 1.10
opensips-emergency-module - 1.10
opensips-geoip-module - 1.10
opensips-http-modules - 1.10
opensips-identity-module - 1.10
opensips-jabber-module - 1.10
opensips-json-module - 1.10
opensips-ldap-modules - 1.10
opensips-lua-module - 1.10
opensips-memcached-module - 1.10
opensips-mysql-module - 1.10
opensips-perl-modules - 1.10
opensips-postgres-module - 1.10
opensips-presence-modules - 1.10
opensips-rabbitmq-module - 1.10
opensips-radius-modules - 1.10
opensips-redis-module - 1.10
opensips-regex-module - 1.10
opensips-restclient-module - 1.10
opensips-sctp-module - 1.10
opensips-snmpstats-module - 1.10
opensips-sqlite-module - 1.10
opensips-tls-module - 1.10
opensips-tlsmgm-module - 1.10
opensips-unixodbc-module - 1.10
opensips-wss-module - 1.10
opensips-xmlrpc-module - 1.10
opensips-xmpp-module - 1.10
No subscription required

criterions.comment: opensips package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.10').
